heaviest_rainfall.status: The most intense rainfall recorded took place on 04 January 2025, with precipitation totalling 36.8mm.  The rain fell at 4.6mm per hour at times over the course of the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: 27.0mm per hour was the maximum rain rate ever recorded on 02 September 2025, during a 15.0 hour storm which dumped 21.19mm of rain from the clouds.

longest_rain.status: A relentless rainstorm took place on 04 January 2025, it lasted 37.2 hours and it delivered 36.8mm of rain at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

storm.status: No stormy weather is anticipated.  The last big storm was recorded on 07 September 2025, lasting 1 days.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no cold snap in progress.  So far, 6 cold snaps have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 3.7.

extreme.status: The record temperature difference stands at 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C), set on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is no heatwaves at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 heatwavess, with an average of 1.9 per year.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was recorded on 18 July 2025.  The total number of occurrences since 1973 number is only 62.

average.status: The current average wind direction is southerly (182°), which differs from the average south-westerly (234.0°) by approximately 52.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The highest wind gust ever seen was 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: To date, the maximum wind run recorded was 1754 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The record wind speed remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 5.8°C) and outside temperature (down 4.6°C) and drier conditions in rainfall (down 0.1 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 387 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 1252 m), feels like temperature (up 5.6°C), outside temperature (up 4.0°C), and outside humidity (down 5%) when compared to today.

Today’s average cloud levels is 386.7m lower than yesterday, 482.6m lower than the past week, 1251.6m lower than the past month.

Yesterday’s cloud levels showed a low of 1181m and a peak of 2400m, averaging 1212.0m; the week and month recorded warmer averages.

summary.summary: Inside; a mild and comfortable temperature is anticipated. Outside; mild and pleasant. Also, air moisture should feel ok and near calm conditions. Drizzle or light rain possible, clouds will occasionally block sunlight, and it’s dim outside. Weather could become unsettled.
